irony.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a situation that is unusual or amusing because something strange happens, or the opposite of what is expected happens or is true
irony.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Life is full of little ironies.
The tragic irony is that the drug was supposed to save lives.
irony.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: when you use words that are the opposite of what you really mean, often in order to be amusing
irony.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: Wagner calls his program ‘the worst talk show in America, ’ without a hint of irony.
‘Of course Michael won’t be late; you know how punctual he always is, ’ she said with heavy irony.
